content.description: Up slab with two bolts, then right into the corner surmounting a large block that creates a small overhang. Step onto the right wall and into a right-facing corner, and up to a fixed anchor on the left side of the corner.
content.location: At the large left rising ramp about 100' left of the giant oak that marks WMD and Shock and Awe.

content.description: Another blocky choss endeavor up a slab and into a depression right of Shelving Rock Earth Penatrator.
content.location: In front of the big oak.

content.description: I feel this is the best of the three routes in this on this face.  Climb slab up under an overlap.  Pass this on the left to gain a stance.  Make a traverse left that seems a bit harder than the original 5.6 rating then up to the anchors.
content.location: Right most line in front to the big oak

content.description: Angle left up easy rock and pull an easy rough and basically walk to the anchors.
content.location: There is a large oak tree under a lower angle slab witj three bolt lined. This is the furtherst left line

content.description: Climb ledge, then zig-zag big holds to a bulge.  Then work around the left side and climb to a tree with a fixed anchor.
content.protection: It has 5-6 bolts, with a fixed anchor on a tree.
content.location: It is directly to the left of El Kabong.

climbs.name: El Kabong
climbs.fa: Tom Rosecrans and Royce Van Evera

content.description: Steep climbing on sharp holds. Move up and right over the triangular ledge. Pass a bulge then up easier terrain to the anchor.
content.location: The second route from the left end of the Desert Shield Area. Starts below and to the left of a triangular shaped ledge.

content.description: This crag is plaqued with some of the chossiest rock at Shelving that will mostly likely rain down on you at some point while climbing here.  That being said, the easiest routes are located here.  Belayers should wear a helmet and be on the look for falling rocks.  Despite small bits of loose rock here and there the climbs are actually a good time.
